content.description: Fun route, one of the first routes you encounter on this wall.
content.protection: Mix route with bolts and gear to 4" sling knobs, pitch 1 and 2 pro anchor, walk off or 3 raps with 2 ropes.
content.location: Second route to the left on the wall.

climbs.name: Peasant Uprising
climbs.fa: Sean Neville, Dan Rampe May 2018 GU

content.description: This route is located under storming the castle and climbs slab/pillar right of big chimney.  Start the climb from the bottom of the chimney and trend up and right clipping bolts to the crux roof.  Climb over the roof  followed by slab moves past 3 bolts aiming for the bottom of crack/flake. Climb the flake moving up and left to undercling then step up and clip two bolts to two bolt anchor.  Rap with single 70 m rope.  Gear: single to 4 inch, 7 bolts.
content.location: Start under "Storming the Castle" and right of "Road to Zion"

content.description:
P1 - Either climb directly up the face to the left facing crack/arête or use the wide flake on the left to get off the ground and then traverse right.  Using the crack in the corner for pro, head for the small roof above.  Bouldery moves surmount the roof and lead past a second bolt.  From here, head up easy knobs past the left side of the larger roof above.  Finishes on a good ledge with bolts.

P2 - Curve left (easier climbing and better pro) before aiming for the obvious semi-circular hole in the roof directly above the belay.  Face climbing leads to the hole and a bolt just beyond it.  Head for the top on easier ground.

Descent

Head left and find the chain anchors for Control Your Pipe.  From here, three single rope raps (watch your rope - lots of features to try and eat them) lead back to the base.  Otherwise, continue for a short pitch up the face or take the gully on the left side wit a fixed rope.  From the summit, rap the Great Depression.
content.protection: Gear to 4" (emphasis on small), knob slings
content.location: Two-thirds of the way up the Alley Wall, just before a large right facing flake.  Looking up, you will see a small roof with bolts before and after it.
